segment.source: How to use the File Locations page in the IEAK 11 Customization Wizard to change the location of your install package and IE11 folders.
segment.target: How to use the File Locations page in the IEAK 11 Customization Wizard to change the location of your install package and IE11 folders.

segment.source: Use the File Locations page in the IEAK 11 Wizard (Internet Explorer Administration Kit 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Use the File Locations page in the IEAK 11 Wizard (Internet Explorer Administration Kit 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Use the File Locations page in the IEAK 11 Wizard
segment.target: Use the File Locations page in the IEAK 11 Wizard

segment.source: The File Locations page of the Internet Explorer Customization Wizard 11 lets you change the location of your folders, including:
segment.target: The File Locations page of the Internet Explorer Customization Wizard 11 lets you change the location of your folders, including:

segment.source: Where you’ll create and store your custom installation package.
segment.target: Where you’ll create and store your custom installation package.

segment.source: Where you’ll download and store Internet Explorer 11.
segment.target: Where you’ll download and store Internet Explorer 11.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: You can create a custom installation package on your hard drive and move it to an Internet or intranet server, or you can create it directly on a server.
segment.target: You can create a custom installation package on your hard drive and move it to an Internet or intranet server, or you can create it directly on a server.

segment.source: If you create the package on a web server that’s running from your hard drive, use the path to the web server as the destination folder location.
segment.target: If you create the package on a web server that’s running from your hard drive, use the path to the web server as the destination folder location.

segment.source: Whatever location you choose, it must be protected by appropriate access control lists (ACLs).
segment.target: Whatever location you choose, it must be protected by appropriate access control lists (ACLs).

segment.source: If the location is not protected, the custom package may be tampered with.
segment.target: If the location is not protected, the custom package may be tampered with.

segment.source: To use the File Locations page
segment.target: To use the File Locations page

segment.source: Browse to the location where you’ll store your finished custom IE installation package and the related subfolders.
segment.target: Browse to the location where you’ll store your finished custom IE installation package and the related subfolders.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Subfolders are created for each language version, based on operating system and media type.
segment.target: Subfolders are created for each language version, based on operating system and media type.

segment.source: For example, if your destination folder is , then the English-language version is created as subfolders.
segment.target: For example, if your destination folder is , then the English-language version is created as subfolders.

segment.source: Click Advanced Options.
segment.target: Click Advanced Options.

segment.source: The Advanced Options box opens and lets you change how the wizard downloads and gets files, and how it imports settings from your .ins file.
segment.target: The Advanced Options box opens and lets you change how the wizard downloads and gets files, and how it imports settings from your .ins file.

segment.source: Check the box letting IE Customization Wizard 11 look for the latest components, using Automatic Version Synchronization.
segment.target: Check the box letting IE Customization Wizard 11 look for the latest components, using Automatic Version Synchronization.

segment.source: This option lets the wizard connect to the IE Downloads page to look for updated versions of IE since you last ran the wizard.
segment.target: This option lets the wizard connect to the IE Downloads page to look for updated versions of IE since you last ran the wizard.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: You must run Automatic Version Synchronization at least once to check for updated components.
segment.target: You must run Automatic Version Synchronization at least once to check for updated components.

segment.source: Browse to your .ins file location, and then click Open.
segment.target: Browse to your .ins file location, and then click Open.

segment.source: By importing settings from an .ins file, you can re-use existing configurations.
segment.target: By importing settings from an .ins file, you can re-use existing configurations.

segment.source: This saves you time if your packages have the same or similar settings.
segment.target: This saves you time if your packages have the same or similar settings.

segment.source: Browse to your component download folder.
segment.target: Browse to your component download folder.

segment.source: Automatic Version Synchronization automatically checks the component download folder to see if you have the latest version of IE.
segment.target: Automatic Version Synchronization automatically checks the component download folder to see if you have the latest version of IE.

segment.source: To keep this folder up-to-date, you shouldn’t change its location.
segment.target: To keep this folder up-to-date, you shouldn’t change its location.

segment.source: However, if you want to keep both a previous version of IE and the latest version, we recommend you download the components to a different location.
segment.target: However, if you want to keep both a previous version of IE and the latest version, we recommend you download the components to a different location.

segment.source: Click OK to close the Advanced Options box, and then click Next to go to the Platform Selection page.
segment.target: Click OK to close the Advanced Options box, and then click Next to go to the Platform Selection page.
